title: Qantas confirms it will stop printing out Frequent Flyer numbers of boarding passes to stop fraud
text:
Qantas will stop printing Frequent Flyer numbers on boarding passes in a bid to stop hacking.

The flying kangaroo airline has already removed those numbers from its digital passes.

A Qantas spokesman told Daily Mail Australia said they would be removed from printed boarding passes 'over the next few weeks as the systems in each ports are updated'.

Qantas will stop printing Frequent Flyer numbers on boarding passes in a bid to stop hacking

'Qantas Frequent Flyer numbers are being removed from both digital and printed boarding passes to maintain customer privacy,' he said.

'The customer's tier status will remain.'

In the social media age, excited travellers often post images of their boarding passes on Facebook to tell their friends about their holidays.

With the full name of passengers and their Frequent Flyer points on display, hackers can print out boarding passes and gain details of a traveller's schedule.

These details are often sufficient to steal Frequent Flyer points, which are often sold on the black market.
description: Qantas has confirmed it will stop printing out Frequent Flyer numbers on boarding passes 'over the next few weeks'. In the social media age, hackers are selling Frequent Flyer points on the black market.
authors: Stephen Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
